issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.summary: better concurrency handling for TezSessionState - part I

comments.body: Based on potential errors from the stricter checks, there may be part 2
[~sseth] fyi

FileSinkOperator, Operation, MetadataOperation, SQLOperation changes carried forward from some other patch ?

The try { } finally {} in TezTask needs to deal with one special condition. An attempt to submit() dag can result in session.destroy being invoked - in which case I believe the session is lost again, and will never be added back to the queue.

Also - while going through this code, I noticed some other interesting bits. Will post that as a diff - let me know what you think. Definitely seems like a part2 will be required, and unit tests.
No, all changes are part of this patch... TODO comment removal needs to be done in some patch, that's the only unrelated one
Actually I think there are many tangentially related TODOs that can be addressed separately.
What is session.destroy? Rather what object is this; do you mean TezClient::stop?
Wrt close(), I think it should be ok. Right now the session object is often being reused after close; it should work with that. I added another TODO
Updated based on comments and added some TODOs
Same patch for HiveQA, didn't run presumably because JIRA is constantly down.

Here are the results of testing the latest attachment:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12815268/HIVE-14111.02.patch

{color:green}SUCCESS:{color} +1 due to 1 test(s) being added or modified.

{color:red}ERROR:{color} -1 due to 441 failed/errored test(s), 10286 tests executed
*Failed tests:*
{noformat}

[~sershe] - I didn't meant to add complexity to the patch. The one I attached contained comments from me walking through the code - some related to this jira, other comments in general. We could check in the comments (which are added in your second patch). It would be better to create jiras to track them though - especially ones which you think are valid (I think some of the comments in the file I uploaded were questions, and some may not have been valid).

bq. What is session.destroy? Rather what object is this; do you mean TezClient::stop?
In TezTask.submit -> TezSessionPoolManager.getInstance().destroySession(sessionState);

I think that's the main bit which needs to be looked at from your original patch, to get past the core problem here of a session getting lost in case of an error.
Nice test for the patch in QTestUtil...

[~sseth] I don't think that's a problem per current code... some other code reuses the object on failure too. So, the session will be closed and nulled out but the same object could be reused and would be reopened later in a different TezTask, right? 
I added a comment suggesting that we remove that pattern and only use the object once, we can do that in a follow-up
